entry.title: Azerbaijan hints at new meeting between its and Armenia‚Äôs foreign minister

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan hints at new meeting between its and Armenia‚Äôs foreign minister
media:group.media:description:
üìçBaku does not rule out the possibility of another meeting between the Foreign Ministers of Azerbaijan and Armenia. üìçOnly 179 Covid-19 new cases out of the 14,000 cases in Armenia have been vaccinated but need hospital treatment, stated Anahit Avanesyan, Armenia‚Äôs Health Minister. üìçThe bust of the Armenian poet Hovhannes Tumanyan will be installed in Rome.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #DailyArmenia

entry.title: Exploring the broken promises of international law in Palestine

media:group.media:title: Exploring the broken promises of international law in Palestine
media:group.media:description:
Stefan Ziegler is the producer of a film called ‚ÄúBroken - A Palestinian Journey Through International Law.‚Äù The film will be screened in multiple venues and universities in Armenia including the Golden Apricot Film Festival. The story focuses on the humanitarian consequences of the wall built between Israel and Palestine. Stefan explains what the relevance of the film is to Armenians, why understanding international law is important and why emphasis was put on education.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #GAIF

entry.title: ‚ÄúThis post-war year showed a widening of the conflict,‚Äô Dr. Laurence Broers

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄúThis post-war year showed a widening of the conflict,‚Äô Dr. Laurence Broers
media:group.media:description:
What is the situation between Armenia and Azerbaijan a year after the war in Nagorno Karabakh? Is a future for Karabakh without Russia possible? Can Azerbaijan achieve a forced peace? What are the relations between Russia and Turkey in the context of the Nagorno Karabakh conflict?
Dr. Laurence Broers, a London-based scholar, the Caucasus programme director of Conciliation Resources, and an Associate Fellow at Chatham Houses‚Äôs Russia and Eurasia Programme helps answer some of these questions. #CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs 2021 economic growth forecast doubled, says World Bank

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs 2021 economic growth forecast doubled, says World Bank
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe World Bank has revised Armenia‚Äôs economic growth forecast for 2021, raising it to 6.1%.
üìçLithuania has handed over 50,000 doses of the coronavirus vaccine to Armenia.
üìçAzerbaijan has started to use Armenian airspace for civilian flights.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #DailyArmenia

entry.title: 18th annual Golden Apricot Film Festival kicks off in Yerevan

media:group.media:title: 18th annual Golden Apricot Film Festival kicks off in Yerevan
media:group.media:description:
The 18th annual Golden Apricot International Film Festival kicked off in Yerevan on October 3.
From October 3 to 10, Armenian film enthusiasts will have a unique opportunity to enjoy a number of special movies.
This year‚Äôs honorary guest to the festival is American screenwriter and director Paul Schrader. He is the screenwriter of Martin Scorsese's "Taxi Driver" and "Raging Bull".

entry.title: Azerbaijani civilian flights are now using Armenian airspace

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijani civilian flights are now using Armenian airspace
media:group.media:description:
Azerbaijan‚Äôs national carrier Azerbaijani Airlines is now using Armenian airspace for civilian flights on its Baku-Nakhichevan route. Although Armenia and Azerbaijan never officially closed their airspace to each other, air carriers of Azerbaijan have not used Armenia‚Äôs airspace since 2014.
